title: Sugerencia para mejorar la integración de Copilot en VSCode

labels.name: ai-translated
labels.description: issues translated by the classifier notebook llm

body: Type: Feature Request Estimado equipo de desarrollo, Como usuario activo de herramientas de desarrollo asistido por IA, quiero expresar una necesidad clara: que Copilot se integre en Visual Studio Code con el mismo nivel de profundidad que ofrece Cursor IDE. Actualmente, Copilot requiere que el usuario copie y pegue contenido o proporcione contexto manualmente. Esto interrumpe el flujo de trabajo y consume tiempo. En cambio, Cursor IDE permite que el asistente acceda directamente al árbol de archivos, modifique código, entienda el proyecto completo y actúe como un verdadero copiloto. Solicito que Copilot evolucione hacia una experiencia similar o superior, con acceso directo a los archivos del proyecto, capacidad de edición automática, comprensión contextual persistente y ejecución de código dentro del entorno. Esta mejora no solo aumentaría la productividad, sino que posicionaría a Copilot como una herramienta líder en desarrollo asistido por IA. VS Code version: Code 1.102.2 (c306e94f98122556ca081f527b466015e1bc37b0, 2025-07-22T12:15:48.520Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 Modes:

title: Explorer/Editor: Copy-pasting multiple files shows new file as selected but editor stays on original
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.0 (user setup)
- OS Version: Windows 11

When you copy a single file and paste into a new folder, the new file will appear as selected in the explorer and it will be opened in the editor (expected, awesome).

When you copy multiple files at once and paste into a new folder, the new file of the one you were originally focused on will appear as selected in the explorer BUT will not be opened in the editor (unexpected, not ideal).

The number of times I'm in a monorepo, creating a new package and copying over the base files from another package (package.json, tsconfig.json) and accidentally rename the original package without noticing, continue to run `pnpm install` or `pnpm build` and get errors.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the explorer, select a file
2. Hold shift and click to select multiple files
3. Copy the selected files (`ctrl`+`c`)
4. Navigate to a different folder in the explorer
5. Paste the files (`ctrl`+`v`)

Observed:
- In the explorer, the new copy of the file you were originally focused on appears selected
- In the editor, the original file is still open instead of the copied file

Expected:
- The copied file that appears selected in the explorer should also be the active file in the editor, just like when copying a single file

title: Show command descriptions as tooltips in Command Palette
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

When using the Command Palette (`Ctrl+Shift+P`), only the command title is shown in the list.
If you don't already know what a command does, the only way to find out is to run it or go search for it.

I think we could improve this by showing the command’s description (if available) when you hover over it.

VS Code already stores descriptions for a lot of commands (both core and from extensions) in the `CommandsRegistry`. Right now that data isn’t surfaced in the UI, which feels like a missed opportunity.

### Why this would help
- Makes it easier to explore and understand less common commands.
- Good for new users who are still learning what’s available.
- Doesn’t require any new data — we’d just use what’s already there.

### Idea for implementation
- In the quick input list rendering (`quickInputList.ts`), grab the metadata for each command from `CommandsRegistry.getCommand(id)`.
- If it has a description, set it as the `title` attribute for that list item (browser/Electron will show this as a tooltip).
- Fallback to the command’s title if there’s no description.

**Example:**

Before:  
Hover over `Toggle Side Bar Visibility` → nothing happens.

After:  
Hover over `Toggle Side Bar Visibility` → shows “Shows or hides the sidebar in the workbench”.

If this sounds reasonable, I’m happy to try implementing it.

labels.description: Issues concerning the fetch internal tool and web extracting service

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: I just got on this without realizing it as I asked it to do the work then switched windows: I think if the exact URL is mentioned in the chat request, we should show in the confirm dropdown to always allow mentioned URLs. This could enable a setting. There is of course some risk with this which is why it's opt-in, but personally I always want URLs I mention explicitly to be auto approved.

body:
Support for MSYS2 git breaks in version 1.103. Roll back to 1.102.3 from last month and it works again.

There are quite some previous reports of this issue from years ago, but there have not been activity in the old issues for quite some time. Since MSYS2 git has been working for me in the past year, I think that the old issue has been addressed many years ago and just that nobody closed the issue.  
This time I think it is probably a brand new issue....  

Thank you!

title: Fix disclaimer word wrapping by preserving normal spaces instead of non-breaking spaces
body:
Tool confirmation disclaimers (such as MCP server warnings) were not wrapping properly in narrow containers because all spaces were being converted to non-breaking spaces (` `), causing text overflow and poor readability.

## Problem

The issue occurred in tool confirmation dialogs where disclaimer text like:
```
Note that MCP servers or malicious conversation content may attempt to misuse 'Code - Insiders' through tools.
```

Was being rendered as:
```html
Note that MCP servers or malicious conversation content may attempt to misuse 'Code - Insiders' through tools.
```

This prevented proper word wrapping in narrow UI containers, causing text overflow and horizontal scrolling.

## Root Cause

The `MarkdownString.appendText()` method intentionally converts all spaces and tabs to ` ` to preserve formatting:

```typescript
.replace(/([ \t]+)/g, (_match, g1) => ' '.repeat(g1.length))
```

While this is appropriate for preserving code formatting and preventing markdown syntax issues, it's problematic for disclaimer text that needs to wrap naturally.

## Solution

Modified the tool confirmation components to use `MarkdownString.appendMarkdown()` specifically for disclaimer text, which preserves normal spaces and allows proper word wrapping:

- Added optional `isDisclaimer` parameter to markdown rendering methods
- When `isDisclaimer=true`, uses `appendMarkdown()` instead of `appendText()`
- Maintains backward compatibility for all other content

## Files Changed

- `chatToolConfirmationSubPart.ts` - Standard tool confirmations
- `chatTerminalToolSubPart.ts` - Terminal tool confirmations

Both files received identical fixes to ensure consistent behavior across all tool confirmation dialogs.

Fixes #260806.

title: build/npm: add explicit npm version validation in preinstall.js (mirrors Node.js check)
body:
# Summary

This PR addresses issue [[#252372] by adding explicit npm version validation to the existing `build/npm/preinstall.js` script, following the maintainer preference outlined in the issue discussion.

## Changes Made

- **This PR modifies only** `build/npm/preinstall.js`.
- **Extended existing Node.js validation logic** in `build/npm/preinstall.js` to include npm version checking
- **Added `VSCODE_SKIP_NPM_VERSION_CHECK` environment variable** for consistency with existing `VSCODE_SKIP_NODE_VERSION_CHECK`
- **Set minimum npm version requirement to v10.8.0** *(chosen to align with the current Node requirement; happy to adjust if the team prefers)*
- **Maintained identical error messaging patterns** using ANSI colors and consistent formatting
- **Added robust error handling** for npm unavailability and version parsing failures
- **Preserved all existing functionality** while seamlessly integrating npm validation


## Implementation Details

### Approach Rationale
- **Centralized validation**: Keeps all version enforcement in single `preinstall.js` file as preferred by maintainers
- **No `engines` field**: Avoids adding `engines` to `package.json` to prevent maintenance overhead from multiple sources of truth
- **Consistent patterns**: Reuses exact same regex parsing, comparison logic, and error styling as existing Node validation

### Technical Implementation
```javascript
// Uses same regex-based parsing as Node validation
const npmVersion = /^(\d+)\.(\d+)\.(\d+)/.exec(npmVersionOutput.trim());

// Maintains identical comparison logic
if (majorNpmVersion < 10 || (majorNpmVersion === 10 && minorNpmVersion < 8)) {
    console.error('\x1b[1;31m*** Please use npm v10.8.0 or later for development.\x1b[0;0m');
    throw new Error();
}
```

### Error Messages
- **Availability check**: "npm is not available. Please ensure npm is installed and available in PATH."
- **Version requirement**: "Please use npm v10.8.0 or later for development."
- **Upgrade guidance**: "Run 'npm install -g npm@latest' to update npm to the latest version."

## Testing

- [x] Verified with npm 10.8.0+ (passes validation)
- [x] Verified with npm < 10.8.0 (fails with appropriate error)
- [x] Verified with npm unavailable (fails with clear error message)
- [x] Confirmed `VSCODE_SKIP_NPM_VERSION_CHECK=true` bypasses validation
- [x] Ensured all existing functionality remains unchanged
- [x] Validated error message formatting matches existing Node validation

## Verification (manual)
### Fail (old npm):
```bash
REAL_NPM="$(command -v npm)"
mkdir -p /tmp/npmshim
cat > /tmp/npmshim/npm <<SH
#!/usr/bin/env bash
if [[ "$1" == "--version" ]]; then
  echo 10.7.9
  exit 0
fi
exec "$REAL_NPM" "$@"
SH
chmod +x /tmp/npmshim/npm

PATH="/tmp/npmshim:$PATH" npm install
# Expect: "*** Please use npm v10.8.0 or later for development." and exit
```
### Pass (compatible npm):
```bash
rm -rf /tmp/npmshim
npm install
# Expect: install proceeds (no preinstall error)
```
### Skip (env override):
```bash
# If needed, recreate the shim from the Fail step (10.7.9)
PATH="/tmp/npmshim:$PATH" \
VSCODE_SKIP_NPM_VERSION_CHECK=1 \
npm install
# Expect: install proceeds (npm gate skipped)
```




**Maintainer Preference Honored:**
- ✅ Extends existing `preinstall.js` validation (as requested by @deepak1556)
- ✅ Avoids `engines` field in `package.json` (as explicitly rejected by maintainers)
- ✅ Maintains single source of enforcement
- ✅ Minimizes maintenance burden

## Related

- Closes #252372
- Alternative to PRs #255060 and #260368 (which add `engines` field)

## Checklist

- [x] My code follows VS Code's [[coding guidelines](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Coding-Guidelines)]
- [x] Changes are minimal and focused on the specific issue
- [x] No pure formatting changes to unmodified code
- [x] Consistent with existing codebase patterns
- [x] Backwards compatible (all existing functionality preserved)
- [x] Includes appropriate error handling
- [x] Tested across different npm versions
- [x] Documentation in code explains the approach
- [x] Links to related issue (#252372)

title: Allow manual control of folder and file order in VS Code Explorer

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
Currently, the VS Code Explorer automatically arranges folders and files alphabetically. While this is convenient in many cases, there are situations where manual control over the order is highly beneficial.

Problem

Developers may want to keep certain files/folders at the top for quick access.

Alphabetical sorting can make related files appear far apart.

Some workflows (e.g., project templates, teaching materials, structured guides) require a specific order.

Proposed solution

Add an option to manually drag and drop files/folders in the Explorer to set a custom order.

Save this order in workspace settings or a separate configuration file.

Allow switching between alphabetical and custom order easily.

Benefits

Improves navigation efficiency.

Supports teaching, demos, and specific project organization needs.

Gives users more flexibility.

Additional context
Many other editors and file managers provide a way to control file/folder order manually. Bringing this capability to VS Code would improve usability for many workflows.

title: Didn't detect that task was still running

labels.name: tasks
labels.description: Task system issues

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
It ran a task, I got "basic" shell integration for some reason (that just happens sometimes, I dunno), and after a bit it tried to detect whether the task was still running. I notice a couple things in this request

```
## Request Messages
### Assistant
~~~md
Evaluate this terminal output to determine if there were errors or if the command ran successfully:  *  Executing task: node_modules/.bin/gulp hygiene

[22:09:25] Using gulpfile ~/code/vscode/gulpfile.js
[22:09:25] Starting 'hygiene'...
[22:09:25] Starting check-package-json ...
[22:09:25] Finished check-package-json after 14 ms
[22:09:25] Starting hygiene ...
[...]

## Response
### Assistant
~~~md
Based on the terminal output provided, it appears that the command executed successfully without any errors. Here’s a breakdown of the output:
[...]
```

Looks like the input is being passed as an assistant message which isn't typical. And it seems pretty obvious that the task is still running, but it did not detect that. But to me, the prompt isn't quite asking whether the task is _complete_, just whether there were errors or not. I would expect that an LLM can figure out this scenario if you find the right prompt.

[baebe447.md](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21703692/baebe447.md)

Also see that it called `get_task_output` right after `run_task` when it already had the output, which is odd.

title: TodoList Tool is not accessible from the keyboard

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: accessibility
labels.description: Keyboard, mouse, ARIA, vision, screen readers (non-specific) issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Type: Bug 1. Open VSCode and ask a prompt that would start planning and use a to do list such as: Help me develop a fully accessible Monopoly game that is screen reader friendly and use a todo list. 2. The todo list will initially be shown in chat and is visible with alt+f2. 3. Shift + Tab from the Chat input field until you reach the Tasks button and it will show its state as expanded. I should be able to expand this with the arrow keys I think but space and enter will perform these actions. 4. Using the Alt + F2 Hotkey yeilds the output from chat and not the task list. Additional Notes: This comes from the release notes from the latest version of VSCode: Track progress with task lists Setting: chat.todoListTool.enabled The great thing about agent mode is that you can give it a high-level task and have it implement it. As it plans the work and breaks it down into smaller tasks, it can be overwhelming to track the progress of all these individual tasks. We are introducing the task/todo list feature in chat to better help you see which tasks are completed and which ones are still pending. You can view the task list at the top of the Chat view, so you always have visibility into the progress being made. As the agent progresses through its work, it updates the task list. Expectations: I would love for this to do list to remain visible and accessible in view some how. This is a cool feature to watch the results of vibing in VSCode. In addition, the checked state when reviewing the window with the JAWS cursor does not show the checked or unchecked state of items. The JAWS cursor is not a solution. Native support should be made available to be accessible. title: "Open with Code" option missing from folder context menu on Windows after update 1.103.0

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.103.0 (User Setup)
Commit: e3550cfac4b63ca4eafca7b601f0d2885817fd1f
Date: 2025-08-06T21:40:10.271Z
Electron: 37.2.3
ElectronBuildId: 12035395
Chromium: 138.0.7204.100
Node.js: 22.17.0
V8: 13.8.500258-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100

Describe the bug
After updating VS Code to version 1.103.0, the "Open with Code" option no longer appears in the right-click context menu when I click on any folder in File Explorer. This feature worked normally in previous versions.

Steps to Reproduce:

Install VS Code version 1.103.0 (User Setup) on Windows.

Open File Explorer.

Right-click any folder.

Look for the "Open with Code" option in the context menu.


I have tried reinstalling VS Code with the options "Add 'Open with Code' to Windows Explorer directory context menu" enabled, but the issue persists.

This problem started immediately after updating to 1.103.0.

It happens on all folders, not just specific ones.

title: Copilot fails to authorize against OpenAI despite of API key provided
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.0
- OS Version: macOS 15.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open "Manage Models" from Copilot chat window
2. Click the gear next to OpenAI
3. Enter a valid API key 
4. Open "Manage Models" again, open OpenAI, select desired models from the list
5. Select one of the previously enabled models, i.e. from that part of the list where the lines are "<model name> OpenAI"
6. Make a request. Most likely it will pass and a reply will be generated.
7. Do another request. This is where the problem usually pops up as the following error is likely to be produced instead of a reply:

   ```
   Sorry, your request failed. Please try again. Request id: c47e8053-7285-4414-ae3a-86b138826ced

   Reason: You didn't provide an API key. You need to provide your API key in an Authorization header using Bearer auth (i.e. Authorization: Bearer YOUR_KEY), or as the password field (with blank username) if you're accessing the API from your browser and are prompted for a username and password. You can obtain an API key from [https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys](vscode-file://vscode-app/Applications/Visual%20Studio%20Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-browser/workbench/workbench.html).
   ```

8. Opening a new chat window is likely to result in the same error right away, starting with the first request.
9. With certain amount of patience steps 1..8 can be repeated one or more extra times. The outcomes may vary in the number of successful requests. Sometimes clicking the "Try again" button may even produce a response, but eventually the error will be back. Sometimes switching to another model from the same OpenAI-provided group and clicking "Try again" helps to get a result immediately. 

## Request IDs

The one from the error message is the latest one I got while testing: c47e8053-7285-4414-ae3a-86b138826ced. It is nowhere to be found in the logs though. 

There is another one to be found in the following part of the logs:

```
2025-08-09 22:50:00.906 [info] Request ID for failed request: e24dffe9-3ff2-4244-9b79-cc3ed17a977b
2025-08-09 22:50:00.909 [debug] Resetting copilot token on HTTP error 401
2025-08-09 22:50:00.909 [debug] Handling CopilotToken refresh.
2025-08-09 22:50:00.910 [info] ccreq:212fa5ac.copilotmd | badRequest | gpt-5 | 149ms | [copilotLanguageModelWrapper]
2025-08-09 22:50:01.044 [debug] Getting CopilotToken (force: undefined)...
```

If I'm not mistaken, it corresponds to the one from the error message above.

title: Slow ItemTable SQL queries

labels.name: debt
labels.description: Code quality issues

labels.name: workbench-state
labels.description: UI state across restarts

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
SQLiteStorageDatabase uses a simple schema w/ `ON CONFLICT REPLACE`:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/0c69046d8c345459eebc98368aef3de480fc7a19/src/vs/base/parts/storage/node/storage.ts#L329-L331

and then relies on `INSERT` queries only to update data:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/0c69046d8c345459eebc98368aef3de480fc7a19/src/vs/base/parts/storage/node/storage.ts#L106-L107

However this is quite slow, and can be optimized using an [UPSERT mechanism](https://sqlite.org/lang_upsert.html)

Here is a microbench showing the difference:

```shell
cat <<EOF > schema.sql
PRAGMA user_version = 1;
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS ItemTable (key TEXT UNIQUE ON CONFLICT REPLACE, value BLOB);
EOF

cat <<EOF > q1.sql
BEGIN;
INSERT INTO ItemTable (key, value) VALUES ('test', '123');
COMMIT;
EOF

cat <<EOF > q2.sql
BEGIN;
INSERT INTO ItemTable (key, value) VALUES ('test', '123') ON CONFLICT (key) DO UPDATE SET value = excluded.value WHERE value != excluded.value;
COMMIT;
EOF

bash -c 'cat schema.sql; for i in {1..1000}; do cat q1.sql; done' > q1-1000.sql
bash -c 'cat schema.sql; for i in {1..1000}; do cat q2.sql; done' > q2-1000.sql
```

```shell
❯ for i in {1..10}; do time sqlite3 /tmp/test.db < q1-1000.sql; done
sqlite3 /tmp/test.db < q1-1000.sql  0.01s user 0.18s system 82% cpu 0.230 total
```

title: Remote-WSL: Explorer shows false “Canceled” / “file(s)…deleted or moved” even though action succeed
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.0 (and insiders 1.104.0)
- OS Version: Windows 11 24H2 (26100.4652)
- Extension: Remote – WSL 0.99.0 (also tried 0.88.5)
- WSL2:  6.6.87.2-microsoft-standard-WSL2
- Distro: Ubuntu 24.04 (up-to-date)
- Repros with a fresh server (~/.vscode-server/ removed and auto-reinstalled)

### Summary
In Remote-WSL, file operations initiated from the Explorer (create folder, paste file) complete on disk, but VS Code immediately shows error toasts:

- “Canceled” (with “Retry”) after New Folder
- “The file(s) to paste have been deleted or moved…” after Paste

Despite the toasts, the folder/file is present and usable.

Opening the same folder via \\wsl$\<distro>\... (i.e., not using Remote-WSL) avoids the problem entirely. This happens across any project or folder opened within WSL2, including an empty folder.

### Steps to Reproduce:

1.  In WSL2: `mkdir -p ~/repro && cd ~/repro && code .`
2. In VSCode Explorer:
- Right-click the workspace root → New Folder → type abc → press Enter.
- Toast appears: “Canceled” (with Retry button).
3. Observe that abc/ exists

Same process for copying and pasting a file, same result.

### Expected
No error toasts when create/paste succeed.

### Actual
Bogus error toasts for create/paste. Operations do succeed on disk.

### What I have tried already

- Disable all extensions (--disable-extensions) → repro
- rm -rf ~/.vscode-server then reconnect (server reinstalls) → repro
- Uninstall/reinstall Remote – WSL extension → repro
- Downgrade Remote - WSL extension (to 0.88.5) → repro
- **VS Code Insiders** latest → repro
- wsl --update and wsl --shutdown → repro

Happy to provide any logs/traces that might be useful. This seems to have started recently (have not had an issue like this in many years, since WSL1).

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: tasks
labels.description: Task system issues

body: When `get_task_output` was in the extension, we had this code `const buffer = this.terminalService.getBufferForTerminal(terminal, Math.min(options.input.maxCharsToRetrieve ?? 16000, 16000));` Now that it's in core, I see the tool returning extremely long results, wasting tokens and doing very frequent summarization. And I don't see where it's output would be limited. Why did we remove that? ``` # Tool Call - call_yjpOvYmciC9cA2N08iciyCMo__vscode-1754686273723 ## Request ~~~ id : call_yjpOvYmciC9cA2N08iciyCMo__vscode-1754686273723 tool : get_task_output args : { "id": "npm: Core - Build", "workspaceFolder": "/Users/roblou/code/vscode" } ~~~ ## Response ~~~ [5000 lines of output] ```

title: Add “Expand to Full Screen” Button for Code Editor Window

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: workbench-editors
labels.description: Managing of editor widgets in workbench window

labels.name: layout
labels.description: General VS Code workbench layout issues

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Description: Currently, the VS Code terminal and Copilot Chat panels have an “expand” button at the top right, allowing users to maximize them to full screen and then restore them. I would love to have a similar “expand to full screen” button for the main code editor window. This would make it easy to focus on code without distractions, especially when working on a single file.

Why this is useful:

Quickly maximize the code editor for focused work.
Consistent UI/UX with terminal and chat panels.
Easy to restore the previous layout after expanding.

title: Chat autoApprove doesn't work with redirected output

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: chat-terminal
labels.description: The run in terminal tool in chat

body:
Sometimes copilot tries to run commands like:

```
npm run lint 2>&1 | findstr /C:"✖" /C:"problems"
```

My autoApproves include:

```
	"chat.tools.terminal.autoApprove": {
		"/^findstr /": true,
		"/^npm run lint/": true,
	}
```

Since both of these are regexes that are not anchored to the end, I would have expected them to be allowed, but I think the `&` is preventing it:

```
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] autoApprove: All sub-commands NOT auto-approved []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] autoApprove: Command line NOT auto-approved []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] - Command 'npm run lint' is approved by allow list rule: /^npm run lint/ []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] - Command '' has no matching auto approve entries []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] - Command '1' has no matching auto approve entries []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] - Command 'findstr /C:"✖" /C:"problems"' is approved by allow list rule: /^findstr / []
2025-08-09 16:58:32.143 [info] - Command line 'npm run lint 2>&1 | findstr /C:"✖" /C:"problems"' has no matching auto approve entries []
```

I don't know whether this can safely be handled, but it would be nice if it could (to avoid the auto-approve rules having to be too lax).

title: Enabling additional paid premium requests did not allow more premium requests
body:
Type: Bug I hit my quota on premium requests for Github, and was informed by the chat. I clicked the link, and updated my budget for premium requests. Now, I try to switch to a premium model and submit my question, and it kicks me back to GPT-4.1. I have found that it WILL occasionally allow the premium model, especially if I log out from github and then in again, or close VSCode. title: MCP Servers contributed by an extension do not show in the "MCP Servers" list on the extension sidebar

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

labels.name: chat-mcp-management
labels.description: Issues related to browsing and managing MCP Servers in VS Code

body: On the extensions tab, MCP servers installed or configured in `mcp.json` appear: However servers that are contributed by extensions do not show here. This can be confusing to users - they might assume they do not have the MCP server contributed by an extension (for example the Dart extension contributes the MCP server from the Dart SDK) and then manually add it (which could result in duplicates). The hover could include the source of the MCP Server (for example the extension name, if it's from an extension) so it's clear to the user what they have and where they came from.
